# GTKX

> React framework for building native GTK4 desktop applications on Linux

## What it does

Write React components in TypeScript that render as native GTK4 widgets.
Not a webview - actual native widgets through Rust FFI.

## Tech stack

- Frontend: React 19, TypeScript
- Native: Rust, Neon (Node.js native modules)
- Target: GTK4, Adwaita (Libadwaita)
- Build: pnpm, Turbo, Vite
- Test: Vitest

## Packages

@gtkx/react - React reconciler and component system
@gtkx/ffi - Generated FFI bindings to native module
@gtkx/native - Rust/Neon native module
@gtkx/cli - CLI tools and dev server
@gtkx/css - CSS-in-JS styling
@gtkx/testing - Test utilities
@gtkx/codegen - FFI code generator
@gtkx/gir - GIR file parser

## Architecture

React JSX → @gtkx/react reconciler → @gtkx/ffi → @gtkx/native (Rust) → GTK4 C API

Props: React state → FFI call() → GTK properties
Events: GTK signals → FFI callbacks → React handlers

## Entry points

render() from @gtkx/react - Mount React app to GTK
gtkx CLI - Create projects, run dev server

## File layout

packages/react/src/render.tsx - render() function
packages/react/src/host-config.ts - React reconciler
packages/react/src/nodes/*.ts - Widget implementations
packages/native/src/lib.rs - Rust FFI exports
packages/ffi/src/index.ts - JS FFI wrapper
girs/*.gir - GObject Introspection files

## Commands

npm run build - Build all packages
npm run codegen - Generate FFI from GIR
npm run test - Run tests
npm run dev - (in example) Start dev server

## Examples

examples/todo - Task management app
examples/gtk4-demo - Widget gallery
examples/lists - List components
examples/adwaita - Libadwaita components
examples/deploying - Flatpak packaging

## Basic usage

```tsx
import { render, GtkApplicationWindow, GtkButton, quit } from "@gtkx/react";

const App = () => (
  <GtkApplicationWindow title="App" onCloseRequest={quit}>
    <GtkButton label="Click" onClicked={() => console.log("clicked")} />
  </GtkApplicationWindow>
);

render(<App />, "com.example.app");
```
